title.narrative: Kinshasa Multisector Development and Urban Resilience Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve institutional capacity for urban management and access to select infrastructure and services, as well as to socio-economic opportunities in Kinshasa.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section I.A.2(a): The Recipient shall, no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, or such later date asagreed by the Association, establish, and thereafter maintain throughout Project implementation, a steering committee (“StrategicSteering Committee”), chaired by the Minister of Urban development and Housing and co-chaired by the Minister of MIPW, with termsof reference, composition and powers acceptable to the Association and defined in the PIM, to provide overall strategic guidanceand oversight and approve the Annual Work Program;

Schedule 2, Section I.A.2(b): The Recipient shall, no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, or such later date asagreed by the Association, establish a technical committee (“Operational Committee”) with terms of reference, composition andpowers acceptable to the Association and defined in the PIM, to coordinate and oversee Project implementation to ensurecoordination among stakeholders at the subnational level

Schedule 2, Section I.B.1: No later than 30 days after the Effective Date, and prior to the carrying out of any water andsanitation activity under Component 1.1(a) and 1.1(b) of the Project, the Recipient shall make part of the proceeds of theFinancing available to the CEP-O/REGIDESO on grant terms under a subsidiary agreement between the Recipient and the CEP-O/REGIDESO,under terms and conditions approved by the Association, which shall include the CEP-O/REGIDESO's obligation to carry out theProject activities under its responsibility in accordance with the provisions set forth in this Agreement, including the PIM, theESCP and the Anti-Corruption Guidelines (“CEP-O/REGIDESO Subsidiary Agreement”).Schedule 2, Section III(B).1 Notwithstanding theprovisions of Part A above, no withdrawal shall be made […] (b) for payments under Category 1(b) until and unless the ESIA and RAPfor the construction works under Component 1.1(c)(i) of the Project have been prepared, consulted, approved and published, all inform and substance acceptable to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I.D.1: The Recipient shall, through the CI, not later than November 30 in each calendar year during Projectimplementation, prepare and furnish to the Association, a program of Project activities proposed for implementation in thefollowing calendar year.

Schedule 2, Section III(B).1 Notwithstanding the provisions of Part A above, no withdrawal shall be made […] (c), for paymentsunder Category (3)(b) until and unless the Recipient has updated, based on an audit of the official governmental water connectionscarried out under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association, the procedures for making regular payments of amounts billedby REGIDESO pursuant to a performance contract between the Recipient and REGIDESO under terms and conditions acceptable to theAssociation; all as further described in the PIM.”

Schedule 2, SectionI.E.7: “if 60 days prior to the Closing Date, the Association determines that there are measures and actionsspecified in the ESCP which will not be completed by the Closing Date, the Recipient shall: (a) not later than 30 days before theClosing Date, prepare and present to the Association, an action plan satisfactory to the Association on the outstanding measuresand actions, including a timetable and budget allocation for such measures and actions (which action plan shall deemed to beconsidered an amendment of the ESCP); and (b) thereafter, carry out said action plan in accordance with its terms and in a manneracceptable to the Association.”

Without limitations upon the provisions of Section I.B.1 of Schedule 2 to this Agreement, the Recipient shall ensure that REGIDESOmakes publicly available through its website the following documents:• (a) audited annual financial statements together with theaudit report and management report for the corresponding calendar year, no later than 8 months after the end of each calendar yearcovering the calendar year (or such later date as agreed with the Association and as set forth in the PIM) starting in calendaryear 2022; • (b) semi-annual unaudited financial statements (or at a minimum an income statement), no later than 3 months afterthe end of each calendar semester (or such later date as agreed by the Association and as set forth in the PIM), covering thecalendar semester, starting in calendar year 2022; • (c) the approved annual budget, no later than 3 months after the beginning ofthe each calendar year (or such later date as agreed with the Association and as set forth in the PIM), starting in calendar year2022;• (d) the annual investment/capex plan, no later than 3 months after the beginning of the each calendar year (or such laterdate as agreed by the Association and as set forth in the PIM) starting in calendar year 2022; and• (e) no later than one yearafter the Effective Date, or such later date as agreed by the Association and set forth in the PIM, the company strategy, thecomposition of its Board of Directors and management teams (including remuneration aspects) and the company collective bargainingagreement, all under terms and conditions as set forth in the PIM.Schedule 2, Section III(B).1: Notwithstanding the provisions ofPart A above, no withdrawal shall be made […] (d) for payments under Category (6), until and unless the Association is satisfiedthat all the following conditions have been met in respect of said activities:(i) (A) the Recipient has determined that anEligible Crisis or Emergency has occurred, has furnished to the Association a request to withdraw financing amounts under Category(5); and (B) the Association has agreed with such determination, accepted said request and notified the Recipient thereof; and (ii)the Recipient has adopted the CERC Manual and Emergency Action Plan, in form and substance acceptable to the Association.
